t: Proverbs 19
Better*pn is*i the poor who walks in his integrity Than*ld one*i who*i is*i perverse in his lips, and is a fool.
Also*ln it is not good for*i a soul to*i be*i without knowledge, And*ld he sins who hastens with his*i feet.
The*ln foolishness of a man twists his way, And*ld his heart frets against the Lord.*s
Wealth*ln makes many friends, But*ld the poor is separated from his friend.
A*ln false witness will not go unpunished, And*ld he*i who*i speaks lies will not escape.
Many*ln entreat the favor of the nobility, And*ld every man is*i a friend to one who gives gifts.
All*ld the brothers of the poor hate him; How*ld much more do his friends go far from him! He*ld may pursue them*i with*i words, yet*i they abandon him.*i
He*ln who gets wisdom loves his own soul; He*ld who keeps understanding will find good.
A*ln false witness will not go unpunished, And*ld he*i who*i speaks lies shall perish.
Luxury*ln is not fitting for a fool, Much*ld less for a servant to rule over princes.
The*ln discretion of a man makes him slow to anger, And*ld his glory is*i to overlook a transgression.
The*ln king’s wrath is*i like the roaring of a lion, But*ld his favor is*i like dew on the grass.
A*ln foolish son is*i the ruin of his father, And*ld the contentions of a wife are*i a continual dripping.
Houses*ln and riches are*i an inheritance from fathers, But*ld a prudent wife is*i from the Lord.*s
Laziness*ln casts one*i into a deep sleep, And*ld an idle person will suffer hunger.
He*ln who keeps the commandment keeps his soul, But*ild he who is careless of his ways will die.
He*ln who has pity on the poor lends to the Lord,*s And*ld He will pay back what he has given.
Chasten*ln your son while there is hope, And*ld do not set your heart on his destruction.
A*iln man*i of*i great wrath will suffer punishment; For*ld if you rescue him,*i you will have to do it again.
Listen*ln to counsel and receive instruction, That*ld you may be wise in your latter days.
There*ln are many plans in a man’s heart, Nevertheless*ld the Lord’s*s counsel—that will stand.
What*ln is desired in a man is kindness, And*ld a poor man is better than a liar.
The*ln fear of the Lord*s leads*i to life, And*ld he*i who*i has*i it*i will abide in satisfaction; He*ld will not be visited with evil.
A*ln lazy man*i buries his hand in the bowl, And*ld will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
Strike*ln a scoffer, and the simple will become wary; Rebuke*ld one who has understanding, and*i he will discern knowledge.
He*ln who mistreats his*i father and*i chases away his*i mother Is*ild a son who causes shame and brings reproach.
Cease*ln listening to instruction, my son, And*ld you will stray from the words of knowledge.
A*ln disreputable witness scorns justice, And*ld the mouth of the wicked devours iniquity.
Judgments*ln are prepared for scoffers, And*ld beatings for the backs of fools.
